Package org.jtrim2.collections

Interface ReservedElementRef<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the element referenced
public interface ReservedElementRef<T>
Defines an element removed from a collection, but still taking up space as if it was there. To release the space this reference

Thread safety

The thread-safety of the instances of this class depends on its owning collection. If the collection is not safe to be used from multiple threads concurrently, then this reference must not be accessed concurrently by the owning collection.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this interface are required to be synchronization transparent, so they can be called in any context (e.g.: while holding a lock).
See Also:
  • ReservablePollingQueue
  • ReservablePollingQueues

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    T
    element()
    Returns the referenced element.
    void
    release()
    Completely frees the reservation of this element from the owning collection, so that this element takes up no space there.

  • Method Details

    • element

      T element()
      Returns the referenced element. The element may be retrieved multiple times even after calling release, and each call will return the same object (keeping identity).
      Returns:
      the referenced element. May only return null, iff the owning collection supports null values.

    • release

      void release()
      Completely frees the reservation of this element from the owning collection, so that this element takes up no space there. Freeing the reservation must have happened before this method returns to the caller, unless the owning collection otherwise defines it.

      This method is idempotent, and subsequent calls to this method will have no further effect.
